Description: Body sherd of Chian Grand Style pottery light chalice; creamy white slip; interior glazed black with added white tendrils and added red dots above white zigzag between pairs of bands; below, undetermined floral motif; exterior: painted decoration consisting of parts of two horses to right (on the left, head with bridle, bit and reins; red on brow and neck in outline, shoulder with red and forelegs; on the right, tail with added red of second horse).
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 273, no. 713, pl. 93) (Incorrectly labelled 1888.6-1.497)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0746) (phase 2)
